author: mlzzen
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```
    1.open powershell v6.1.0-preview.2
    2.use command "cd" into Chinese directory
    3.input any letter
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```
    Chinese directory name will overlap.
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```
    Chinese directory name overlap.
```
![screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11664505/41213581-cb902504-6d78-11e8-843f-78c439e965dd.png)


Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0-preview.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.1.0-preview.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17134
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0 

```

other
----------------
```
There is no such problem in win10 1803's powershell.
```
title: Chinese directory name will overlap in v6.1.0-preview.2
